import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)

#Code by Devasshree Madhugiri https://www.kaggle.com/devsubhash/fitness-trackers-market-analysis-eda

#color palette for this notebook
colors = ["#F72585","#B5179E","#7209B7","#560BAD","#480CA8","#3A0CA3",\
"#3F37C9","#4361EE","#4895EF","#4CC9F0","#a5a58d"]
palette = sns.color_palette(palette = colors)

sns.palplot(palette, size =1)
plt.show()
source.2866a5f7:
#Code by Devasshree Madhugiri https://www.kaggle.com/devsubhash/fitness-trackers-market-analysis-eda

# Rating vs Votes
#filter by Genre
list = ["Romance","Western","Adventure, Reality-TV","Animation, Family, Music","Biography, Crime, Drama","Comedy, Drama, Reality-TV","Comedy, Fantasy, Music","Comedy, Game-Show"]
series = koreanImdb_df["Genre"].isin(list)
df_f = koreanImdb_df[series]
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(15,6))
ax = sns.stripplot(x="Rating", y="Votes:", data=df_f,hue="Genre", palette=colors,size=7, marker="o")

source.29da9895:
#Code by Siti K https://www.kaggle.com/khotijahs1/2020-indonesia-university-rank/comments

#The Best 20 Actors by Rating
top_genre = koreanImdb_df.sort_values(by='Rating', ascending=False)[:20]
figure = plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sns.barplot(y=top_genre.Genre, x=top_genre.Rating, palette= colors)
plt.xticks()
plt.xlabel('Rating')
plt.ylabel('Genre')
plt.title('Top 20 Genres by Rating')
plt.show()
source.1d4165cd:
#word cloud
from wordcloud import WordCloud, ImageColorGenerator
text = " ".join(str(each) for each in comment_df.Content)
# Create and generate a word cloud image:
wordcloud = WordCloud(max_words=200,colormap='Pastel1', background_color="black").generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
# Display the generated image:
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='Bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.figure(1,figsize=(12, 12))
plt.show()
source.1844b61f:
#word cloud
from wordcloud import WordCloud, ImageColorGenerator
text = " ".join(str(each) for each in comment_df.Title)
# Create and generate a word cloud image:
wordcloud = WordCloud(max_words=200,colormap='Set2', background_color="white").generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
# Display the generated image:
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='Bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.figure(1,figsize=(12, 12))
plt.show()
